special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Throttle: On a successful grasp attack, the revenant‚Äôs hands lock around the victim‚Äôs throat, inflicting 2d8 automatic damage each subsequent round.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Regeneration: 3 rounds after being damaged, start regaining 3hp per round. Severed limbs reattach.
Return from death: If killed (0hp), will regenerate and fight again in 2d6 rounds.
Fire: Cannot regenerate damage caused by fire. The only way to permanently kill a revenant.
Purpose: Seek out and slay killers (and accomplices). Once this purpose has been accomplished, dissipate into dust.
Class abilities: If the revenant was an adventurer in life, it retains all class abilities, including spell casting.
Monsters.description: The corpse of a person who was murdered, reanimated by the desperate need for revenge. Only the most obsessive individuals return from death in this way.

special_abilities: Suckers: Front legs equipped with suckers for grabbing prey.
Grab: When hit with a sucker, the victim is stuck and will be bitten automatically next round.
Cling: Can walk on walls.
Monsters.description: Huge, hairy, nocturnal arachnid carnivores with large heads and mandibles and 10 legs. Yellow head and abdomen, dark brown thorax. Dwell in caves, hunt voraciously.

special_abilities: Charge: If disturbed or threatened, will charge in a random direction. Requires a clear run of at least 20 yards. Make a horn attack on all in the path: inflicts double damage.
Trample: 3-in-4 chance of trampling each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures.
Monsters.description: Dim, armoured, herbivorous mammals.

special_abilities: Domestic: Not encountered in the wild.
Carry loads: Up to 3,000 coins unencumbered; up to 6,000 at half speed.
Monsters.description: Lightly built horses adapted to run at high speed. Can survive purely on grass, wherever available.

special_abilities: Surprise: Hunt patiently. Surprise on a 1‚Äì4, when waiting in shadows for prey.
Poison immunity: Unharmed by killer bees‚Äô poison.
Leap: Can leap up to 30‚Äô and attack.
Monsters.description: 3‚Äô long, carnivorous flies with yellow and black stripes. Look similar to killer bees, which they hunt. May attack humans.

special_abilities: Weapons: Wield bones or branches as clubs. (Do not use other tools.)
Monsters.description: Large, ferocious, semi-intelligent baboons that live in packs led by a powerful male. Communicate with screams. Omnivorous, but prefers flesh.

special_abilities: Immunity: Unaffected by sleep spells.
Monsters.description: Stony crust filled with magma which they shoot from their fingertips.

special_abilities: Constriction: When a bite attack is successful, the python wraps around the victim and begins to squeeze, inflicting 2d4 automatic damage immediately and on each subsequent round.
Monsters.description: 20‚Äô long snakes with spiralling brown and yellow patterns on their scales.

special_abilities: Tentacles: Can attack up to 50‚Äô away.
Weakness: Victim suffers a ‚Äì3 penalty to attack and damage rolls for 3 turns.
Grab: A victim hit by a tentacle is grabbed and dragged toward the monster's mouth (10‚Äô per round). The victim can only be freed by severing the tentacle.
Severing tentacles: Requires a hit with a magical cutting weapon inflicting 5 or more damage.
Magic resistance: +2 to saving throws.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Energy immunity: Unharmed by cold or lightning.
Spell immunity: Immune to all spells of 1st to 3rd level.
Monsters.description: Horrible, amorphous monstrosities that form their bodies into the shape of a stalagmite or pillar (9‚Äô tall, 3‚Äô across). Carnivorous, but lust most of all after human flesh. Dwell in caverns or forests.

special_abilities: If touched: Burrow rapidly into flesh, seeking the heart. Cause death in 1d3 turns.
Killing: Applying fire in the first 2 rounds after contact kills the grubs. This inflicts 1d6 damage on the victim. Cure disease is also effective.
Monsters.description: Tiny (2‚Äù long) maggots that consume living flesh. Lurk in heaps of dung or rubble, waiting to be touched.

special_abilities: Rusting: Metal that touches a rust monster (e.g. weapons that hit it, or armour struck by a feeler) crumbles instantly to rust. Magic items have a 10% chance per ‚Äúplus‚Äù, to be unaffected on each successful hit. Each time a magic item is affected, it loses one ‚Äúplus‚Äù.
Smell metal: Attracted by the scent.
Monsters.description: Magical, armadillo-like creatures with long tails and two long, antennae-like feelers. Feed on rusted metal.

special_abilities: Pursuit: Always pursue prey that flees.
Favoured prey: Often develop a taste for a certain type of meat (this may include humans!), hunting that creature with preference.
Inquisitive: May follow PCs out of curiosity.
Monsters.description: Huge, aggressive cats with foot-long fangs. Normally only found in Lost World regions.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon) or [2 √ó claw (1d2), 1 √ó bite (1d4)]

special_abilities: Light sensitivity: Suffer a ‚Äì2 penalty to attack rolls and a ‚Äì1 penalty to AC when in bright light (daylight, continual light).
Breathe air: For up to 4 hours.
Underwater hearing: Can hear boats at a range of up to 1 mile away.
Underwater villages: Domed stone buildings concealed with seaweed. Home to 1d3 √ó 100 individuals.
Guardians: 2d4 sharks guard the lair. Obey simple commands from sahuagin.
Monsters.description: Predatory, sadistic aquatic humanoids with black-green scales and deep black eyes. Sometimes known as ‚Äúsea devils‚Äù. Worship evil deities and delight in the killing, enslaving, and torture of other sentient species. Dwell in warm salt water, but make nighttime raids onto land.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon) or [2 √ó claw (1d2), 1 √ó bite (1d4)]

special_abilities: Villages are ruled by a 6+6 HD sahuagin baron.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon) or [2 √ó claw (1d2), 1 √ó bite (1d4)]

special_abilities: Groups are led by a sahuagin with 4+4 HD plus one 3+3 HD lieutenant for every 10 members of the group.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon) or [2 √ó claw (1d2), 1 √ó bite (1d4)]

special_abilities: Groups are led by a sahuagin with 4+4 HD plus one 3+3 HD lieutenant for every 10 members of the group.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon) or [2 √ó claw (1d2), 1 √ó bite (1d4)]

special_abilities: For every 100 sahuagin in a village, there will be a priestess (a cleric of 3rd to 5th level).
Irritant spray: Above water; maximum once a turn. Can spray one target: save versus poison or stunned for 1 turn.
Ink cloud: Underwater; maximum once a turn. When escaping, can emit a cloud of black ink to confuse attackers.
Eat ships: Cling to bottom of vessel. Each individual inflicts 1d3 hull damage then drops off.
Noticing ship damage: 50% chance per round of spotting leaks.
Monsters.description: Giant (1‚Äô‚Äì5‚Äô long), wood-eating, aquatic insects with a sack to take in and jet out water. Prone to feeding on passing ships. Only attack creatures if cornered.

special_abilities: Surprise: Only surprised on a 1.
Hide in woods: 90% undetectable when hiding.
Monsters.description: Magical humanoids with the legs and horns of goats. Love dancing, drinking, and debauchery. Dwell in deep, isolated forests.

special_abilities: Magic pipes: One satyr in a group has magic pipes and may play them when encountered for one of the following effects: a. Charm: Used on attractive individuals. Anyone within 60‚Äô who hears the song must save versus spells or be charmed: move towards the satyr (resisting those who try to prevent it); defend the satyr; obey the satyr‚Äôs commands (if understood); unable to cast spells or use magic items; unable to harm the satyr. A character who saves is unaffected for the rest of the encounter. Killing the satyr breaks the charm. b. Fear: Used on powerful enemies. All within 60‚Äô must save versus spells or flee for 2 turns. c. Sleep: Used against intruders not deemed dangerous. All within 60‚Äô must save versus spells or fall asleep for 4d4 turns. Satyrs will rob sleeping victims.
Monsters.description: One satyr in a group has magic pipes and may play them.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó giant weapon (3d6) or 1 √ó tail sting (1d10 + poison)

special_abilities: Weapons: Typically use polearms or long bows.
Poison: Causes death (save versus poison). Even if the save succeeds, the victim is paralysed and convulsing for 1d8‚Äì1 rounds.
Pets: Often keep giant scorpions as pets.
Monsters.description: Hideous, 12‚Äô tall monsters with the legs, body, and stinging tail of a giant scorpion, and a humanoid upper body and head. Ruthless hunters who hate all other sentient species. Dwell in warm climates in caverns, deserts, and mountains.

special_abilities: Breath weapon: Poison spittle, 100‚Äô range, 20‚Äô diameter. Save versus breath or die. (Poison is harmless after 1 round.)
Language and spells: 20%; 3 √ó 1st level, 3 √ó 2nd level.
Sleeping: 30%.
Gliding: Leap out of the water and glide for up to 6 rounds.
Monsters.description: Intelligent, aquatic dragons with green scales, fin-like wings, and a yellowish crest. Dwell in the depths of the ocean, inhabiting caverns or shipwrecks. Sometimes they attack vessels to steal their treasure and eat the crew.
Monsters.habitat: Depths of the ocean (caverns or shipwrecks)

special_abilities: Hideous visage: Anyone who looks at a sea hag must save versus spells or be weakened (‚Äì2 penalty to attacks and damage) for 1d6 turns.
Deadly gaze: Three times per day, may gaze at a character within 30‚Äô. The target must save versus death or die instantly.
Magic resistance: +2 bonus to all saving throws against magic.
Freshwater hag: A very rare subspecies of sea hag dwells in freshwater pools.
Monsters.description: Ghastly, green-skinned, weed-festooned crones who crave humanoid flesh. Dwell in seaweed forests in warm shallows.

special_abilities: Pinprick bite: 50% chance of going unnoticed.
Poison: Slow acting: effects felt after 1d4+2 turns. Save vs poison or die 1 turn later. At this point, the neutralize poison spell has a 25% chance of not working.
Larger individuals: Sea snakes with more than 3 HD may be encountered. They are 6‚Äô long for every 3 HD.
Monsters.description: 6‚Äô long snakes that live underwater, coming up for breath only once per hour. Will prey on humans.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì5.
Strength drain: Victims lose 1 STR per hit. Recovers after 8 turns. If reduced to 0 STR, the victim becomes a shadow.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Spell immunity: Unaffected by charm and sleep spells.
Monsters.description: Intelligent, incorporeal (but not undead) monsters that look like shadows. Able to slightly change their shape.

special_abilities: Suffocation: If a victim is hit by both fists in the same round, they are entangled in the shambler‚Äôs roots and tendrils and suffocate in 2d4 rounds. The victim can only be freed if the shambler is killed.
Weapon damage reduction: All weapon damage reduced by half.
Fire immunity: Unharmed by fire, due to being soaked with slime.
Lightning growth: If damaged by lightning, gains one Hit Die.
Seep: Can flatten their body to squeeze through small holes.
Monsters.description: Sentient, semi-intelligent plant monsters with the shape of a roughly humanoid (9‚Äô tall), slime-soaked mound of vegetation. Dwell in forlorn swamps and damp underground locales.

special_abilities: Shriek: Triggered by light (up to 60‚Äô away) or movement (up to 30‚Äô away). Shriek lasts for 1d3 rounds. Each round of the shriek, there is a 50% chance of a wandering monster being attracted (will arrive in 2d6 rounds).
Monsters.description: Giant, subterranean mushrooms that can creep around slowly.

special_abilities: Breath weapon: 80‚Äô long cone of cold (all caught in the area suffer damage equal to the dragon‚Äôs current hit points‚Äîsave versus breath for half) or cloud of paralysing gas (save versus breath or paralysed for 9 turns).
Language & spells: 50%; 3 √ó 1st level, 3 √ó 2nd level, 3 √ó 3rd level.
Sleeping: 10%.
Shape changing: May take on the form of a person or animal.
Monsters.description: Dwell in clouds or on mountain peaks.

special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Monsters.description: Skeletal remains of humanoids, reanimated as guardians by powerful magic-users or clerics. Often encountered in cemeteries, crypts, or other forlorn places.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì5, unless target can detect invisibility.
Tracking: Do not attack directly, but follow a single victim until they sleep.
Detecting: Victim has a 1-in-20 chance of noticing that they are being followed by the slithering tracker.

Paralysis: For 6 turns (save versus paralysis). Paralysis continues indefinitely if the tracker maintains physical contact. Once a victim is paralysed, the tracker extracts their blood plasma at a rate of 2d6 hit points per turn.
Seep: Can squeeze through small holes and cracks.
Monsters.description: Transparent, intelligent oozes that subsist on the blood plasma of sentient creatures. Dwell in gloomy ruins and dungeons.

special_abilities: Stampede: Herds of 20 or more can trample those in their path. 3-in-4 chance each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures. 1d20 damage.
Males: In groups of 3 or more, only 1-in-4 are males. These have 1d4 extra hit points and protect the herd.
Females and young: Flee from danger. Females do not have a butt attack. Young have half normal hit points.
Monsters.description: For example: antelope, deer, goats.

special_abilities: Stampede: Herds of 20 or more can trample those in their path. 3-in-4 chance each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures. 1d20 damage.
Males: In groups of 3 or more, only 1-in-4 are males. These have 1d4 extra hit points and protect the herd.
Females and young: Flee from danger. Females do not have a butt attack. Young have half normal hit points.
Monsters.description: For example: antelope, deer, goats.

special_abilities: Alignment reaction: ‚Äì1 to reaction rolls versus Neutral characters; ‚Äì2 versus Chaotic characters.

Swoop: Can dive onto victims visible from above. If the victim is surprised, the attack inflicts double damage. On an attack roll of 18 or more, the victim can be carried away (if of appropriate size).
Eggs: 1d6 eggs or chicks in 50% of nests.
Trainable: Can be trained, if captured when young.
Monsters.description: Gigantic birds of prey that nest in the highest peaks of isolated mountain ranges. Will attack intruders, if approached carelessly.
Monsters.habitat: Highest peaks of isolated mountain ranges

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó bite (1d10 + poison) or 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon)

special_abilities: Poison: Causes death in 1d6 turns (save versus poison).
Magic resistance: +4 bonus to all saving throws against magic.
Cults: Sometimes found among human cults that worship snakes.
Crossbreeds: Human/snake person hybrids are said to be possible. Such creatures appear as humans, except for their snake-like eyes and forked tongues.
Monsters.description: Depraved monsters with the sinuous body, tail, and head of a giant snake and scaly humanoid torso and arms. Capture other sentients to be eaten or sacrificed in obscene rituals praising their demonic masters. Dwell in hot jungles.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 1 √ó bite (1d10 + poison) or 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon)

special_abilities: For every 10 snake people in the lair, there will be 1 priest with the ability to cast spells as a 5th level cleric.
Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Aura of fear: All coming within 30‚Äô must save versus spells or flee for 1 turn.

Disease: Anyone hit contracts a horrible rotting disease (save versus poison with a +4 bonus). Permanently lose 2 points of CHA per month (death if CHA reaches 0); magical healing is ineffective; natural healing is ten times slower. The disease can only be removed by magic.

Burrowing worms: A worm leaps from the spawn‚Äôs skull at a character in melee. This requires an attack roll. If the worm hits, it starts to burrow into the victim‚Äôs flesh. In 1d4 rounds, it reaches the brain, killing the victim, who becomes a spawn of the worm in 6 turns.
Killing worms: The first round after a worm hits, it can be killed by contact with steel, holy water, or a blessed object. Subsequently, only magic (e.g. cure disease) will work.
Regeneration: Regain 2hp per round. Severed limbs reattach.
Return from death: If killed (0hp), regenerate and fight again in 2d6 rounds.
Fire, acid, holy water: Cannot regenerate damage from these sources. The only way to permanently kill a spawn.
Monsters.description: Grotesque, animated human corpses in an advanced state of rot. Brains have been entirely devoured by vile worms, which fill the skull cavity and writhe out of the eyes and mouth. Dwell in dungeons, tomb complexes, and swamps.

special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.

Energy drain: A successfully hit target permanently loses two experience levels (or Hit Dice). This incurs a loss of two Hit Dice of hit points, as well as all other benefits due to the drained levels (e.g. spells, saving throws, etc.). A character‚Äôs XP is reduced to the lowest amount for the new level. A person drained of all levels becomes a spectre next night, under the control of the spectre that killed them.
Monsters.description: Incorporeal phantoms; one of the most powerful undead monsters.

special_abilities: Swallow whole: An attack roll of 4 or more than the target number required indicates a human-sized (or smaller) victim is swallowed. Inside the whale‚Äôs belly: suffer 3d6 damage per round (until the whale dies); may attack with sharp weapons at ‚Äì4 to hit; body digested in 6 turns after death.
Ram ships: 10% likely to attack vessels.
Monsters.description: Gargantuan whales are up to 60‚Äô long. Dwell in open oceans and hunt deep sea monsters (e.g. giant squids).

special_abilities: Roar: All within 120‚Äô must save versus spells with a ‚Äì4 penalty or flee in terror for 1d6 turns. Characters within 60‚Äô who fail the save are stunned (unable to move or act) for 1d6 rounds and then flee. Characters within 10‚Äô also suffer 6d6 damage and are deafened for 1 turn.
Roar frequency: May be used at most twice per day.
Magic: Cast magic-user spells, once per day each: detect magic, read languages, read magic, detect invisible, locate object, clairvoyance, dispel magic, remove curse.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Monsters.description: Large (8‚Äô tall) monsters with bird-like wings, the body of a lion, and a human head. Collect riddles, puzzles, and obscure lore. May pose riddles to those they meet, attacking and consuming any who cannot give the correct answer. Dwell in warm climes in ruins and wild areas.

special_abilities: Blinding spit: Range: 6‚Äô. A hit causes permanent blindness (save vs poison).
Poison: Causes death in 1d10 turns (save versus poison).
Monsters.description: 3‚Äô long snakes with grey/white scales. Prefer to attack from a distance with spit.

special_abilities: Curse: Five sprites can collectively curse a target (no attack roll; save versus spells). The effect is determined by the referee, but will always be used to comical effect (e.g. target trips, target‚Äôs nose grows).
Pranksters: Even if attacked, sprites have no interest in killing, merely in making practical jokes.
Monsters.description: 1‚Äô tall, winged humanoids, related to pixies and elves. They are shy, but driven by curiosity and their odd sense of humour.

special_abilities: Trample: 3-in-4 chance of trampling each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures.
Monsters.description: Stocky, herbivorous dinosaurs with a ridge of plates along their backs, and a tail studded with spikes (used to deter attackers). Dwell in sub-tropical Lost World environments.

special_abilities: Dive attack: First attack is at +2 to hit.
Blood sucking: Upon a successful attack, it attaches and drains the victim's blood: 1d3 automatic damage per round.
Detach: If the Stirge or victim dies.
Monsters.description: Feathered, bird-like creatures with long, sharp beaks.

special_abilities: Weapons: Stone clubs made from huge stalactites.
Boulder throwing: Up to 300‚Äô.
Guardians: 50% chance of 1d4 cave bears.
Monsters.description: 14‚Äô tall humanoids with stone-like, grey skin. Dwell in natural caverns or primitive huts built of stone.

special_abilities: Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Immunity: Unharmed by gas; unaffected by charm, hold, and sleep spells.
Slow aura: Anyone within 10‚Äô must save versus spells or be slowed for 1 turn (move at half normal speed, attack or cast spells only every second round).
Energy immunity: Unharmed by fire, cold, and electricity.
Monsters.description: 10‚Äô tall humanoid statues of solid stone.

special_abilities: Summon storm: Takes 1 turn.

Lightning bolts: In a storm, may throw lightning every 5 rounds: 60‚Äô long, 5‚Äô wide; inflicts damage equal to the giant‚Äôs current hit point total (save vs spells for half damage); bounce off of hard surfaces in path.
Lightning immunity: Unharmed by lightning. Enjoy basking in storms.
Castle: High among mountain peaks, atop banks of clouds, or in deep waters.
Guardians: 2d4 griffons. Underwater: 3d6 giant crabs.
Monsters.description: 22‚Äô tall humanoids with bronze-hued skin and garish hair (red or yellow).

special_abilities: Entangle: A victim hit by a frond is entangled and suffers 1d4 automatic damage on each subsequent round. May make a STR check each round to escape.
Clusters: Each frond is treated as an individual monster, but clusters of multiple fronds are controlled by a single semi-intelligent ‚Äúbrain‚Äù in the seabed.
Monsters.description: 10‚Äô long fronds of rubbery seaweed that seek out living prey. Dwell in warm seas.

stat_block.Morale_Rating: 8 (10 in sight of leader or chieftain)

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4 underground, due to ability to blend into stone.
Infravision: 90‚Äô.
Light sensitivity: Suffer a ‚Äì2 penalty to attack rolls and a ‚Äì1 penalty to AC when in bright light (daylight, continual light).
Hate deep ones and mind lashers: Normally attack on sight.
Mines and machines: Love machinery, mining, and gems.
Monsters.description: Short, thickset demihumans with long noses and gnarled, hairless, grey skin. Also known as deep gnomes. Dwell deep in the Underworld in labyrinthine lairs riddled with cunning secret passages and chambers.
1d6 3 HD bodyguards (with 1d4 + 9hp) live in the lair.

special_abilities: A 4 HD chieftain (with 18hp) lives in the lair.
The chieftain gains a +1 bonus to damage.
Summon earth elemental: Once per day, leaders and chieftains can summon an 8 HD earth elemental for 1d6 turns.
A 2 HD leader (with 11hp) is present for every 20 Svirfneblins.
Summon earth elemental: Once per day, leaders and chieftains can summon an 8 HD earth elemental for 1d6 turns.
Irritant spray: Above water; maximum once a turn. Can spray one target: save versus poison or stunned for 1 turn.
Ink cloud: Underwater; maximum once a turn. When escaping, can emit a cloud of black ink to confuse attackers.
Eat ships: Cling to bottom of vessel. Each individual inflicts 1d3 hull damage then drops off.
Noticing ship damage: 50% chance per round of spotting leaks.
Monsters.description: Giant (1‚Äô‚Äì5‚Äô long), wood-eating, aquatic insects with a sack to take in and jet out water. Prone to feeding on passing ships. Only attack creatures if cornered.

special_abilities: Aura of terror: Creatures of under 3 HD who behold a tarrasque are paralysed with terror until it is out of sight. Creatures of more than 3 HD will instead flee in terror for 6 turns. Creatures of 7 HD or higher may save vs paralysis to resist.
Charge: In the first round of combat, when not in melee. Requires a clear run of at least 20 yards. Horns inflict double damage.
Severing: A bite attack roll of 18 or higher indicates that one of the target‚Äôs extremities (determined randomly, e.g. 1‚Äì2: leg, 3‚Äì4: arm, 5‚Äì6: head) is severed.
Regeneration: A damaged tarrasque gains 1hp at the start of each round.
Return from death: If killed (0hp), will regenerate, reforming completely from even only a tiny piece.
Killing permanently: Only possible by reducing to 0hp then using a wish.
Energy reflection: Immune to energy rays, cones, and bolts (lighting, cold, magic missiles, etc.). 1-in-6 chance of the attack being reflected back at its origin.
Fire immunity: Unharmed by fire.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Carapace: 10d10 diamonds (1,000gp value each) can be extracted from the carapace. It is also possible to craft magic shields from the plates.
Sleeping: Sleep in lair for months or years, before emerging for 1‚Äì2 weeks of voracious feeding.
Unique: It is rumoured that there may only be a single tarrasque.
Monsters.description: Legendary, gargantuan (50‚Äô long) reptilian monstrosities dreaded throughout all lands. Spend most of their time sleeping in their underground lairs. Emerge periodically and ravage vast swaths of land, consuming all plants and animals in the path. Tarrasques are quite possibly the most feared monster of all.

stat_block.Attack_Description: 2 √ó claw (1d3 + paralysis) or 1 √ó weapon (1d6 or by weapon)

special_abilities: Paralysis: Successful attacks cause paralysis for 2d4 turns (save versus paralysis negates). Elves and creatures larger than ogres are unaffected. After paralysing a target, Thouls will attack others.
Regeneration: A damaged Thoul gains 1 hit point at the start of each round, as long as it is alive.
Monsters.description: Magical monstrosities that look like hobgoblins (except on close inspection), but combine the powers of ghouls and trolls. Sometimes live among hobgoblins.

special_abilities: Pursuit: Always pursue prey that flees.
Favoured prey: Often develop a taste for a certain type of meat (this may include humans!), hunting that creature with preference.
Inquisitive: May follow PCs out of curiosity.
Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4, in woodland, due to camouflage.
Monsters.description: Large, solitary hunters with striped camouflage markings. Favour woodlands and cooler regions.

special_abilities: Invisibility: At will. Become visible when attacking or casting spells.
Levitation: At will. Move vertically up to 20‚Äô per round.
Spell casting: Know how to cast 2 cleric spells of each level (1st to 5th) and 2 magic-user spells of each level (1st to 6th). Each spell known may be cast once per day.
Language: Speak the tongues of all giants.
Giant companions: 2-in-10 chance of a storm giant being encountered with titans.
Monsters.description: Gargantuan (22‚Äô tall) humanoids of radiant beauty and athletic build. Beneficent of character, but prone to megalomania. Natives of higher planes, but sometimes have strongholds in the mortal world.
Monsters.habitat: Higher planes, or strongholds in mortal world

special_abilities: Peaceful grazers: Will not attack if left alone.
Trample: 3-in-4 chance of trampling each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures.
Monsters.description: Giant (12‚Äô at the shoulder), ancient relatives of the rhinoceros, with massive, blunt horns. Eat grass and tree leaves. Dwell in small herds in Lost World grasslands.

special_abilities: Arms: Usually carry: hand-axe, sword, shield, furs (equivalent to leather armour).
Mules: In the wilderness, have 1d4 mules loaded with trade goods (e.g. carved wooden items, furs, spices).
Monsters.description: 1st level fighters who live by trading in borderland areas.

special_abilities: Lure: Often form a protrusion resembling a chest near the centre to lure prey.
Surprise: On a 1‚Äì5, due to camouflaged appearance.
Trap: Affects all within the 20‚Äô square area the trapper covers. A single attack roll is made and compared against the AC of all targets.
Trapped victims: Cannot move, automatically suffer 1d8 damage per round. Can attack the trapper only if they had a short weapon (e.g. dagger, short sword) in hand when trapped.
Suffocation: Trapped victims die after 6 rounds due to suffocation.
Damage reduction: Half damage from fire and cold-based attacks.
Monsters.description: Intelligent, cunning predators that stretch their stony, amorphous bodies flat across large areas of floor. Wait for victims to walk across, then fold up, trapping the victims. Typically cover a 20‚Äô square area (though larger specimens are occasionally encountered). Dwell underground.

special_abilities: Distrust fire: And those who wield it.
Surprise: On a 1‚Äì3, in a forest, due to being mistaken for a tree. Encounter occurs at 30 yards or less.
Animate trees: Each individual can animate 2 trees (within 60‚Äô; may switch trees at will). These fight as Treants with movement rate 30‚Äô (10‚Äô).
Monsters.description: Giant (18‚Äô tall) humanoids that look like trees. Dwell in forests. Are concerned only with protecting the plants of their home. Speak their own long-winded and circuitous language.

special_abilities: Aggressive: Normally attack on sight.
Charge: In the first round of combat, when not in melee. Requires a clear run of at least 20 yards. Horns inflict double damage.
Trample: 3-in-4 chance of trampling each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures.
Monsters.description: Massive (12‚Äô to the shoulder, almost 40‚Äô long), aggressive, herbivorous dinosaurs with a protective crest behind the head, and three long horns. Dwell in Lost World grasslands.

special_abilities: Magic resistance: +4 bonus to all saving throws against magic.
Weapons: Tridents (1d6 damage), crossbows, daggers.
Mounts: Roving bands are usually mounted on hippocampi or giant seahorses.
Lairs: Beautiful castles on the seabed or caverns sculpted into undersea rocks. Lairs are lavishly decorated with coral.
Guardians: Use trained sea creatures to guard their homes.
Divine purpose: According to legend, tritons were brought to the mortal world from the plane of elemental water for some special purpose which will be revealed when the time is right.
Monsters.description: Aquatic humanoids with silvery skin, blue-green hair, and scaled legs ending in fins. Dwell in warm waters both in shallow and at great depths.

special_abilities: In the lair, there is a high priest (with the abilities of a 10th level cleric).
A 9 HD triton rules the lair.

The king has a magical conch shell which he can blow (up to 3 times per day) to calm rough seas in a 1-mile radius, to summon 6d6 hippocampi or giant seahorses, or to cause marine animals within 240‚Äô to flee for 3d6 turns (save versus spells).
For every 10 in a group, there is a 5 HD leader.
In the lair, there is a 75% chance of a triton with the abilities of a magic-user (level 1d6+4).
In the lair, there is 1d4 priests (4th level clerics).
Hateful: Attempt to kill any creatures they encounter.
Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4, due to the ability to change colour to match their surroundings. Lurk by rock walls and await victims.
Nauseating stench: Oils on the skin have a smell that sickens humans and demihumans: save versus poison or suffer ‚Äì2 to hit, while in melee with troglodytes.
Monsters.description: Intelligent, reptilian humanoids with agile hands, long legs, short tails, and spiky combs on their heads and arms.

special_abilities: Regeneration: 3 rounds after being damaged, start regaining 3hp per round. Severed limbs reattach.
Return from death: If killed (0hp), will regenerate and fight again in 2d6 rounds.
Fire and acid: Cannot regenerate damage from these sources. The only way to permanently kill a troll.
Fear of fire: Morale 8 when attacked with fire or acid.
Monsters.description: Intelligent, wicked, 8‚Äô tall humanoids with emaciated, rubbery bodies. Consume the flesh of other humanoids. Dwell underground, in barren wilderness, and in the ruined homes of former victims.
Monsters.habitat: Underground, barren wilderness, ruined homes of former victims

special_abilities: Large prey: Attack largest target first.
Monsters.description: Great (over 20‚Äô tall), two-legged, predatory dinosaurs with huge jaws. Hunt human-sized or larger prey. Dwell in Lost World regions.

special_abilities: Empathy with maidens: A pure-hearted maiden can communicate with and ride a unicorn.
Teleport: Once per day, up to 360‚Äô (including rider).
Monsters.description: Fantastic creatures that appear as elegant horses with a single long horn. Unicorns are timid, but proud and wilful.

special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.

Energy drain: A successfully touched target permanently loses two experience levels (or Hit Dice). This incurs a loss of two Hit Dice of hit points, as well as all other benefits due to the drained levels (e.g. spells, saving throws, etc.). A character‚Äôs XP is reduced to the lowest amount for the new level. A person drained of all levels becomes a vampire in 3 days.

Charming gaze: Save versus spells at ‚Äì2 or be charmed: move towards the vampire (resisting those who try to prevent it); defend the vampire; obey the vampire‚Äôs commands (if understood); unable to cast spells or use magic items; unable to harm the vampire. Killing the vampire breaks the charm.
Regeneration: A damaged vampire gains 3hp at the start of each round, as long as it is alive.
At 0hp: Change into gaseous form; flee to coffin.

Change form: At will; takes 1 round: a. Humanoid: Standard form. b. Dire wolf: Att 1 √ó bite (2d4), MV 150‚Äô (50‚Äô). AC, HD, morale, saves as a vampire. c. Giant bat: Att 1 √ó bite (1d4), MV 30‚Äô (10‚Äô) / 180‚Äô (60‚Äô) flying. AC, HD, morale, saves as a vampire. d. Gaseous cloud: MV 180‚Äô (60‚Äô) flying. Immune to all weapons. Cannot attack.
Summon beasts: In human form only. Creatures from the surrounding area: 1d10 √ó 10 rats, 5d4 giant rats, 1d10 √ó 10 bats, 3d6 giant bats , 3d6 wolves , or 2d4 dire wolves.
Coffins: Must rest in a coffin during the day or lose 2d6hp (only regenerated by resting a full day). Cannot rest in a blessed coffin. Always keep multiple coffins in hidden locations.

Vulnerabilities: a. Garlic: Odour repels: save vs poison or unable to attack this round. b. Holy symbols: If presented, will keep a vampire at bay (10‚Äô). May attack wielder from another direction. c. Running water: Cannot cross (in any form), except by a bridge or carried inside a coffin. d. Mirrors: Avoid; do not cast a reflection. e. Continual light: Partly blinded by the light from this spell (‚Äì4 to attacks).

Destroying: a. Sunlight: Save versus death each round or be disintegrated. b. Stake through the heart: Permanently kills. c. Immersion in water: For 1 turn permanently kills. d. Destroying coffins: Permanently killed if all hit points are lost when unable to rest in their coffins.

special_abilities: Level and alignment: A group may all be of the same level and alignment, or these may be determined randomly, per individual.
Monsters.description: Low level fighters, often on their way to or from war.

special_abilities: Rot: Tentacles rot flesh. Save versus poison to avoid. If the save fails, the damage inflicted by the hit can only be healed by magic.
Monsters.description: Giant (5‚Äô tall), carnivorous mushrooms that can creep around slowly. Live underground, among shriekers, which they resemble. Feed on the rotting remains of living creatures which stray too close.

special_abilities: Armour: Typically wear a spiked collar and light leather armour. AC reduced to 8 [11] if unarmoured.
Command: Trained to attack on owner‚Äôs command.
Domestic: Not encountered in the wild. Typically cost 25gp (50gp with armour).
Monsters.description: Large domestic breeds selected for their bulk and ferocious nature.

special_abilities: Charge: When not in melee. Requires a clear run of at least 20 yards. Rider‚Äôs lance inflicts double damage. Horses cannot attack when charging.
Melee: When in melee, both rider and horse can attack.
Domestic: Not encountered in the wild.
Carry loads: Up to 4,000 coins unencumbered; up to 8,000 at half speed.
Monsters.description: Bred for strength and courage in battle. Adapted to short bursts of speed; not suited to long-distance riding.

special_abilities: Displacement: Appear 3‚Äô from actual location: attackers suffer ‚Äì2 to hit.
Save bonus: +2 to all saves.
Hate blink dogs: Always attack them and their companions.
Monsters.description: Large, black, six-legged, semi-intelligent monsters. Look similar to panthers with a tentacle growing from each front shoulder. Tentacles ridged with razor-sharp edges.

special_abilities: Formation: Takes 2 rounds to form.
Grab: The victim must save versus paralysis or be dragged underwater.
Submerged victims: Each round: suffer 1d4 automatic damage and must save versus death or become unconscious. An unconscious victim dies after 3 rounds.
Resistance to sharp weapons: Only suffer 1 point of damage.
Return from death: If killed (0hp), will reform with full hp in 2 rounds.
Energy resistance: Cold attacks paralyse for 1d3 rounds (no damage). Half damage from fire attacks.
Killing permanently: Only by magic (e.g. dispel evil, purify food and water).
Water-bound: Must remain in water.
Command water elemental: 50% chance of being able to take over command of a water elemental that is within 30‚Äô.
Monsters.description: Evil spirits that inhabit pools. Take a serpent-like form and lash out at approaching creatures.

special_abilities: Amiable: May be friendly, if approached peacefully.
Bear hug: If a victim is hit by both claw attacks in the same round, the werebear can hug for an extra 2d8 automatic damage.
Monsters.description: Highly intelligent, also in bear form. Dwell alone or among normal bears. Shapechangers with a human and an animal form. Human form: Have physical characteristics reminiscent of the associated animal type. Mundane damage immunity: In animal form, can only be harmed by silver weapons or magic. Languages: In human form, can speak normally. In animal form, can only speak with animals of the associated type. Armour: Not used because it hinders shape-changing. Summon animals: Can summon 1‚Äì2 animals of the associated type from the surrounding area (wererats summon giant rats). These arrive in 1d4 rounds. Wolfsbane: If hit, must save versus poison or flee in terror. Reversion: If killed, a lycanthrope reverts to its human form. Scent: Horses and some other animals can smell lycanthropes and fear them. Infection: A character who loses more than 1/2 their hit points from lycanthropes‚Äô natural attacks (i.e. bites, claws) contracts lycanthropy. Humans become were-creatures of the same type (run by the referee, henceforth); non-humans die. The disease takes full effect in 2d12 days, showing signs of infection after half the time.

special_abilities: Battle rage: In human form, may enter a berserk rage: +2 to hit; fight to the death. Rage sometimes causes them to attack their allies.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4; set ambushes.
Languages: Can speak Common in both forms.
Weapons: May also use weapons in animal form.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4, due to stealth.

special_abilities: The leader gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls.

special_abilities: Territorial: Defend their lair with threats and, if this is ignored, violence.
Monsters.description: Albino, herbivorous, gorilla-like apes that live in caves and emerge at night to forage.

special_abilities: Breath weapon: 80‚Äô long cone of cold.
Language and spells: 10%; 3 √ó 1st level.
Sleeping: 50%.
Monsters.description: Found in cold regions.

special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Mundane damage immunity: Only harmed by silver weapons or magic.

Energy drain: A successfully hit target permanently loses one experience level (or Hit Die). This incurs a loss of one Hit Die of hit points, as well as all other benefits due to the drained level (e.g. spells, saving throws, etc.). A character‚Äôs XP is reduced to halfway between the former and new levels. A person drained of all levels becomes a wight in 1d4 days, under the control of the wight that killed them.
Monsters.description: Corpses of humans or demihumans, possessed by malevolent spirits.

special_abilities: Strength in numbers: Packs of 4 or more wild dogs have morale 8. If the pack is reduced to less than 50% of its original size, this morale bonus is lost.
Monsters.description: Packs of wild dogs roam the wilderness or may, rarely, be encountered in caves.

special_abilities: Stampede: Herds of 20 or more can trample those in their path. 3-in-4 chance each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures. 1d20 damage.
Taming: Wild horses can be trained as mounts (riding horses).
Monsters.description: Lightly built horses adapted to run at high speed. Can survive purely on grass, wherever available.

special_abilities: Invisibility: At will. Cannot attack while invisible.
Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Energy immunity: Unharmed by electrical attacks. Minimum damage from fire.
If reduced to 5 or less hp: Will reveal location of treasure hoard.
Monsters.description: 1‚Äô spheres of bobbing, torch-like light that lure people to their doom in bogs or traps. Feed on the energy of dying souls.

special_abilities: Frost breath: All within 10‚Äô of mouth suffer damage (save vs breath for half).
Breath frequency: Every 10 rounds.
Cold immunity: Unharmed by cold-based attacks.
Vulnerable to fire: Suffer an extra point of damage per die of fire damage.
Pelt: Worth up to 5,000gp intact.
Monsters.description: Large (8‚Äô long), intelligent wolves of an evil disposition. Scintillating, silvery-white fur and pale blue eyes. Dwell in cold climates.

special_abilities: Training: At the referee‚Äôs discretion, captured cubs may be trained like dogs. Wolves are difficult to train.
Strength in numbers: Packs of 4 or more wolves have morale 8. If the pack is reduced to less than 50% of its original size, this morale bonus is lost.
Monsters.description: Dwell primarily in wildlands, but occasionally lair in caves.

special_abilities: Mundane damage immunity: Can only be harmed by magical attacks.
Initiative: ‚Äì1 penalty due to stiff movement.
Flammable: ‚Äì2 to saves against fire attacks; suffers one extra point of damage per die.
Immunity: Unharmed by gas; unaffected by charm, hold, and sleep spells.
Monsters.description: 3‚Äô tall, roughly constructed, humanoid figures of wood.

special_abilities: Charge: If disturbed or threatened, will charge in a random direction. Requires a clear run of at least 20 yards. Make a horn attack on all in the path: inflicts double damage.
Trample: 3-in-4 chance of trampling each round. +4 to hit human-sized or smaller creatures.
Monsters.description: Giant rhinoceroses adapted for cold climates: their bodies covered with shaggy, white fur. Live in herds, in cold Lost World areas.

special_abilities: Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Mundane damage immunity: Only harmed by silver weapons or magic.
Damage reduction: Half damage from silver weapons.

Energy drain: A successfully hit target permanently loses one experience level (or Hit Die). This incurs a loss of one Hit Die of hit points, as well as all other benefits due to the drained level (e.g. spells, saving throws, etc.). A character‚Äôs XP is reduced to the lowest amount for the new level. A person drained of all levels becomes a wraith in one day, under the control of the wraith that killed them.
Monsters.description: Incorporeal, undead monsters that appear as pale, human-like forms of coalescing mist. Dwell in deserted regions or in the homes of former victims.
Monsters.habitat: Deserted regions or in the homes of former victims

special_abilities: Poison: Causes death (save vs poison).
Monsters.description: Winged, two-legged, dragon-like monsters with a long tail tipped with a venomous stinger. Dwell in any terrain, but favour cliffs and forests.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì5, due to blending in with stone.
Move through stone: Can meld into stone and earth, moving at full speed.
Smell metals: Up to 20‚Äô away.
Demand metals: Will leave characters alone if fed on precious metals. Otherwise, 90% likely to attack.
Energy immunity: Unharmed by fire or cold-based attacks. Half damage from electrical attacks.
Earth spells: Move earth pushes 30‚Äô and stuns for 1 round, stone to flesh or transmute rock to mud reduces AC to 9 [10] for 1 round, pass-wall inflicts 1d10+10 damage.
Monsters.description: 5‚Äô tall, radially symmetric monsters with powerful jaws atop their body and a clawed arm, a stumpy leg, and an eye on each of their 3 sides. Eat rare minerals. Natives of the plane of elemental earth who venture to the material plane on occasion in search of food.
Monsters.habitat: Elemental Plane of Earth, occasionally material plane

special_abilities: Area: Each 10 square feet (e.g. 2‚Äô √ó 5‚Äô) covered in yellow mould is treated as one ‚Äúindividual‚Äù. (A 10‚Äô √ó 10‚Äô area would consist of 10 individual moulds.)
Immunity: Unharmed by all attacks but fire (a burning torch does 1d4 damage).
Spore cloud: 50% chance of attacking if touched (or damaged): releases a cloud of spores affecting all within a 10‚Äô cube area.
Choking: Save versus death or die within 6 rounds.
Erosion: Wood or leather in contact with the mould will be eaten away.
Monsters.description: Deadly fungus that covers walls, ceilings, and other surfaces.

special_abilities: Surprise: On a 1‚Äì4, due to camouflage in snow and ice.
Icy squeeze: On an attack roll of 20, victim is squeezed for 2d8 extra damage.
Paralysing gaze: Any who are surprised must save versus paralysis or be frozen still for 3 rounds.
Paralysed victims: Can be struck automatically with both claws and squeezed for an additional 2d8 damage.
Vulnerable to fire: 50% extra damage.
Monsters.description: Large (8‚Äô tall), shaggy ape-like monsters with vicious claws and a taste for human flesh.

special_abilities: Guardians: Always attack on sight.
Initiative: Always lose (no roll).
Undead: Make no noise, until they attack. Immune to effects that affect living creatures (e.g. poison). Immune to mind-affecting or mind-reading spells (e.g. charm, hold, sleep).
Monsters.description: Listless, humanoid corpses, reanimated as guardians by powerful clerics or wizards.
